venue.name: Ashmont/Peabody Square, Dudley Square, the Fenway, Fort Point Channel, Jackson Square and Maverick Square

item.description:
Everyone is invited to Common Boston Weekend '08, a citywide architecture festival featuring open buildings, design displays and neighborhood tours led by design professionals, neighborhood residents, city officials, cyclists and even chefs. It's all free!

Ashmont/Peabody Square
*May 10, 12:30 pm: join Historic New England for a tour of the 1683 Pierce House.
*May 11, 12:30 pm: view the changes underway around Dorchester's Peabody Square through the eyes of designers, residents, historians, chefs and more. Enjoy Ashmont Grill refreshments, a presentation by chef and owner Chris Douglass, and a bonus tour of All Saints Ashmont church at 4 pm.

Dudley Square
*May 8, 6 pm: explore Roxbury's religious evolution at a talk by State Representative Byron Rushing at the Dudley Branch Library.
The rest are on May 10:
*10 am to noon: take a trolley tour of Dudley Square's churches, mosques and synagogues.
*10 to 11:30 am: learn about Roxbury's role in U.S. history on a "From the Puritans to the Patriots" walking tour with WalkBoston.
*Noon to 6 pm: view the results of the Dudley Square Community Charrette and Competition at Hibernian Hall (184 Dudley Street, Roxbury). Design teams have entered proposals for a mixed-use redevelopment of the B-2 police station site. Winners will be announced Saturday and present Sunday at 2 pm.
*12:30 pm and 2:30 pm: tour Project Hope--the first LEED-certified building in Roxbury.
*1 to 2:30 pm: attend a screening of Holding Ground: The Rebirth of Dudley Square at the Dudley Branch Library.
*1 to 3 pm: explore the neighborhoods of Fountain Hill, Fort Hill and Mission Hill on the "Roxbury Peakbagging" tour to gain a fresh understanding of how natural and architectural forces shape our city.
*2:45 to 4:45 pm: the Designery hosts an open studio.

The Fenway
All on May 9:
*11 am and noon: the Friends of Fenway Studios will give visitors an inside look into artists' studios and their National Historic Landmark building.
*11 am: tour the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum.
*Noon to 1:30 pm: explore the Christian Science Center's Mary Baker Eddy Library, Mapparium, Hall of Ideas and Mother Church.
*1:30 pm: tour Fenway Park.
*1 to 2:30 pm: tour Brigham and Women's Carl J. and Ruth Shapiro Cardiovascular Center, which will be the first LEED-certified hospital facility in NE.
*4 pm: visit Symphony Hall.
*6 pm: hop on a bicycle for an Art + Architecture Tour. (Free for the first 20 people to pre-register; others may join the tour at a reduced rate.)

Fort Point Channel
*May 9, noon to 1:30 pm: tour the Moakley Courthouse.
*May 9, noon to 1:30 pm: tour the Macallen Building and its living green roof.
*May 9, 1:30 to 3:00 pm: check out the Artists for Humanity EpiCenter--one of the AIA's top 10 sustainable buildings in the country.
*May 10, 10 to 11:30 am: learn about the history and future of the neighborhood with the BSA's Urban Design Committee.
*May 10, 11 to noon: Learning By Design leads a hands-on walking tour for children (ages 7 and up) and families. Observe, touch, draw and do texture rubbings. We depart from the Children's Museum.
*May 11, 10 to 11:30 am: Urban AdvenTours holds a green buildings bike tour. (Free for the first 20 people to pre-register; others may join the tour at a reduced rate.)
*May 11, noon to 1:30 pm: join the Fort Point Arts Community and experience the artists' studios and public art.
*May 11, 2:30 to 4:30 pm: tour the Institute of Contemporary Art.

Jackson Square
All on May 10:
*11 am to 12:30 pm: local chef Nadine Nelson of Discerning Taste leads a neighborhood food tour of specialty food shops, ethnic eateries, independently owned coffee and tea shops, bakeries, cooperative markets and more.
*12:30 to 1:30 pm: explore the Boston Neighborhood Network's new environmentally sustainable studios in the Egleston Power Station.
*2 to 4 pm: tour Jackson Square and learn about its future from community members, designers and city officials.

Maverick Square
All on May 11:
*11 am: local chef Nadine Nelson of Discerning Taste leads a neighborhood food tour. Munch your way through the best empanadas in the city, Vietnamese pho, old-world Italian food, Salvadorean enchiladas and Peruvian chicken brasas.
*Noon to 2 pm: East Boston Savings Bank opens the building for self-guided tours.
*Noon to 4:00 pm: visit the Atlantic Works Artists Lofts--Cultural Exchange Center & Galleries.
*Noon to 4 pm: the East Boston YMCA hosts an open building.
*1 pm: take a tour exploring "Immigration and Constant Change in East Boston."
*1 pm: take a tour of Bremen Street Park.
*1 pm: ZUMIX opens its building for self-guided tours.

For more information, contact Justin Crane (617-816-3777 or info@commonboston.org) or visit http://www.commonbost... for the latest event schedule.

**PLEASE NOTE: RSVP to http://www.commonbost..., not just at the Meetup site!**
item.why: Celebrate our neighborhoods and communities at this free citywide architecture festival!
item.name: Common Boston Weekend '08
